title: SEO & Metadata Enhancements
description: Improve search engine visibility and social sharing through structured data, Open Graph tags, and per-page meta descriptions. This directly supports the goal of increasing organic discovery of Jeffrey's work and the Flywheel ecosystem.
rationale: The site currently has basic meta tags but lacks structured data (JSON-LD) for rich snippets, comprehensive Open Graph tags for social sharing, and page-specific meta descriptions. These are table-stakes for modern SEO and significantly impact click-through rates from search results and social shares.
considerations: Must balance SEO optimization with page load performance. JSON-LD should be generated server-side. Open Graph images should be optimized and cached. Consider adding Twitter card validator testing to CI.

title: Add JSON-LD structured data for Person schema
description: Implement JSON-LD Person schema on the homepage and about page with comprehensive professional information including name, jobTitle, worksFor, sameAs (social links), knowsAbout (skills/topics), and alumniOf.
rationale: Person schema enables Google Knowledge Panel eligibility and rich snippets. This is particularly valuable for personal brand sites where the individual IS the brand.
implementation_notes: Create a reusable JsonLd component in components/json-ld.tsx. Use Next.js Script component with strategy='beforeInteractive' for JSON-LD injection. Schema should reference siteConfig for consistency.
acceptance_criteria: JSON-LD validates in Google Rich Results Test
Person schema includes all required and recommended fields
No hydration warnings or console errors

title: Add JSON-LD structured data for SoftwareApplication schema
description: Implement SoftwareApplication schema for each Flywheel tool on the projects page to enable rich snippets showing ratings, downloads, and application details in search results.
rationale: SoftwareApplication schema can display star ratings, author info, and other metadata directly in search results, increasing click-through rates for project pages.
implementation_notes: Map project data from content.ts to SoftwareApplication schema. Include applicationCategory, operatingSystem (Cross-platform), offers (Free), author, and aggregateRating where star counts are available.
acceptance_criteria: Each Flywheel tool has valid SoftwareApplication schema
Schema validates in Google Rich Results Test

title: Add JSON-LD Article schema for writing pages
description: Implement Article schema for each blog post/essay with headline, datePublished, dateModified, author, and description to enable rich snippets in search results.
rationale: Article schema enables rich snippets with publication dates and author info, which increases credibility and click-through rates for long-form content.
implementation_notes: Extract frontmatter from markdown files to populate schema. Use BlogPosting subtype for blog posts. Include mainEntityOfPage and publisher information.
acceptance_criteria: Each writing page has valid Article schema
Dates are properly formatted as ISO 8601
Author links to Person schema on homepage

title: Enhance Open Graph and Twitter Card meta tags
description: Add comprehensive Open Graph (og:) and Twitter Card meta tags to all pages with page-specific titles, descriptions, and images. Include og:type, og:site_name, twitter:card, twitter:site, and twitter:creator.
rationale: Social sharing is a primary traffic driver. Proper OG tags ensure links shared on Twitter, LinkedIn, and other platforms display rich previews with images, titles, and descriptions rather than generic links.
implementation_notes: Extend the existing metadata generation in app/layout.tsx. Create page-specific metadata exports in each page.tsx. Generate OG images programmatically or use static images per section. Use twitter:card='summary_large_image' for maximum visual impact.
acceptance_criteria: All pages have unique og:title and og:description
OG images are present and properly sized (1200x630)
Twitter cards validate in Twitter Card Validator
LinkedIn post inspector shows correct previews

title: Create per-page meta descriptions
description: Write unique, compelling meta descriptions for each main page (home, about, consulting, projects, writing, media, contact) optimized for click-through rates.
rationale: Unique meta descriptions improve CTR from search results. Currently the site may be using the same description everywhere or auto-generating from content, which is suboptimal.
implementation_notes: Add description field to page metadata exports. Keep descriptions between 150-160 characters. Include primary keywords naturally. Use action-oriented language.
acceptance_criteria: Each page has a unique meta description

title: Add canonical URLs and hreflang tags
description: Implement canonical URL tags on all pages to prevent duplicate content issues and add hreflang tags if international targeting is desired.
rationale: Canonical tags prevent SEO dilution from URL parameters or trailing slashes. Essential for maintaining clean search indexing.
implementation_notes: Use Next.js metadata API to add canonical. Ensure trailing slash consistency in next.config.js. Consider whether hreflang is needed (probably not for this site).
acceptance_criteria: Canonical URLs match actual page URLs

title: Performance Optimization
description: Optimize site performance for faster load times, better Core Web Vitals scores, and improved mobile experience. Focus on image optimization, lazy loading, 3D scene performance, and bundle size reduction.
rationale: Performance directly impacts user experience, SEO rankings (Core Web Vitals are a ranking factor), and conversion rates. The 3D Three.js scene is particularly heavy and needs optimization for mobile devices.
considerations: Must maintain visual quality while optimizing. Three.js scene may need conditional loading or quality reduction on mobile. Consider using next/image for all images. Bundle analysis should guide optimization priorities.

title: Audit and optimize image assets
description: Audit all image assets for proper sizing, format (WebP/AVIF), and compression. Ensure all images use next/image for automatic optimization. Add blur placeholders for LCP images.
rationale: Images are typically the largest assets on a page. Proper optimization can reduce page weight by 50%+ and significantly improve LCP scores.
implementation_notes: Run 'npx next-image-audit' or similar tool. Convert any remaining PNG/JPG to WebP. Add blurDataURL to hero images using plaiceholder or similar. Ensure all images have explicit width/height to prevent layout shift.
acceptance_criteria: No images larger than necessary for display size

title: Implement lazy loading for below-fold content
description: Add intersection observer-based lazy loading for components below the fold including project cards, timeline, and threads sections. Use Suspense boundaries with skeleton loaders.
rationale: Lazy loading reduces initial bundle size and improves TTI (Time to Interactive). Users see content above the fold faster while below-fold content loads progressively.
implementation_notes: Create a LazySection wrapper component using IntersectionObserver or react-intersection-observer. Wrap each SectionShell in LazySection for pages with multiple sections. Add skeleton loaders that match the layout of actual content.
acceptance_criteria: Below-fold sections lazy load on scroll
Initial JS bundle reduced by measurable amount

title: Optimize Three.js scene for mobile
description: Reduce Three.js scene complexity on mobile devices through adaptive quality settings, reduced geometry complexity, lower resolution rendering, and conditional feature loading.
rationale: The 3D scene is visually impressive but can cause performance issues on mobile devices with limited GPU capabilities. Mobile users are a significant portion of traffic.
implementation_notes: Detect mobile via user agent or screen size. Reduce particle count, geometry segments, and post-processing effects on mobile. Consider using device pixel ratio capping (max 2). Implement frame rate monitoring and automatic quality reduction if FPS drops below threshold. Consider replacing 3D scene with static/CSS animation on low-end devices.
acceptance_criteria: Fallback works on devices without WebGL

title: Analyze and reduce JavaScript bundle size
description: Run bundle analyzer to identify large dependencies and opportunities for code splitting. Implement dynamic imports for heavy components. Consider alternatives to large libraries.
rationale: JavaScript bundle size directly impacts TTI and TBT (Total Blocking Time). Identifying and addressing large dependencies can significantly improve performance.
implementation_notes: Add @next/bundle-analyzer to project. Run 'ANALYZE=true bun run build' to generate report. Look for: duplicate dependencies, large libraries that could be replaced, components that could be dynamically imported. framer-motion and three are likely candidates for optimization.

title: Implement resource hints and preloading
description: Add preconnect hints for external domains (fonts, analytics), preload critical resources (hero image, critical fonts), and prefetch likely navigation targets.
rationale: Resource hints allow the browser to start connections and downloads earlier, reducing perceived load time especially for external resources.
implementation_notes: Add preconnect for any external domains. Preload the hero headshot image. Use next/font for font optimization (already likely in place). Consider prefetching /projects and /writing pages on hover.
acceptance_criteria: Preconnect hints added for external domains

title: Implement service worker for offline support
description: Add a service worker using next-pwa or workbox for offline support and faster repeat visits through intelligent caching of static assets.
rationale: Service workers enable offline access and significantly speed up repeat visits by caching static assets locally. Also enables PWA installation.
implementation_notes: Use next-pwa package for easy integration. Configure cache strategies: network-first for API/dynamic, cache-first for static assets. Add offline fallback page. Test thoroughly to avoid caching issues.
acceptance_criteria: Static assets cached for offline use

title: Accessibility Improvements
description: Ensure the site meets WCAG 2.1 AA standards for accessibility, including keyboard navigation, screen reader support, focus management, and reduced motion support.
rationale: Accessibility is both a moral imperative and increasingly a legal requirement. An accessible site also tends to be more usable for everyone, including power users who prefer keyboard navigation.
considerations: Must test with actual screen readers (VoiceOver, NVDA). Reduced motion preferences already partially implemented in flywheel. Focus states should be visible but not ugly. Skip links should be invisible until focused.

title: Add skip link for keyboard navigation
description: Implement a skip link at the top of the page that allows keyboard users to skip the navigation and jump directly to main content. The link should be visually hidden until focused.
rationale: Skip links are essential for keyboard users who would otherwise have to tab through the entire navigation on every page load. This is a WCAG 2.1 AA requirement.
implementation_notes: Add a visually-hidden-until-focused link as the first focusable element. Link should target main content area with id='main-content'. Use sr-only class with :focus-visible override for visibility. Style should be clearly visible when focused.
acceptance_criteria: Skip link is first focusable element

title: Audit and improve focus states
description: Audit all interactive elements for visible focus states. Ensure focus indicators are visible, consistent, and meet WCAG contrast requirements. Use focus-visible for mouse-friendly styling.
rationale: Visible focus states are essential for keyboard navigation. Many sites remove default focus rings without adding custom ones, making keyboard navigation impossible.
implementation_notes: Use Tailwind's focus-visible: variant for styling. Ensure 3:1 contrast ratio for focus indicators against background. Add consistent ring styling (ring-2 ring-violet-500 ring-offset-2 ring-offset-black). Test tab order is logical.
acceptance_criteria: All interactive elements have visible focus states

title: Add ARIA landmarks and improve semantic HTML
description: Audit and improve semantic HTML structure. Add ARIA landmarks (banner, navigation, main, contentinfo) where not already present. Ensure proper heading hierarchy.
rationale: Screen readers use landmarks and heading hierarchy to help users navigate. Proper semantics also improve SEO and make the code more maintainable.
implementation_notes: Ensure header has role='banner', nav has role='navigation', main has role='main', footer has role='contentinfo'. Check heading hierarchy (h1 > h2 > h3, no skipped levels). Add aria-label to navigation for context.
acceptance_criteria: Heading hierarchy is logical (no skipped levels)
Screen reader can navigate by landmarks

title: Improve screen reader announcements
description: Add aria-live regions for dynamic content updates, improve alt text for images, and ensure interactive elements have accessible names.
rationale: Screen reader users need to be informed of dynamic content changes and need descriptive text for images and interactive elements.
implementation_notes: Add aria-live='polite' to regions that update dynamically (filter results, etc). Review all images for meaningful alt text (decorative images should have alt=''). Ensure all buttons and links have accessible names. Add aria-label to icon-only buttons.
acceptance_criteria: Dynamic updates announced to screen readers
All images have appropriate alt text
All interactive elements have accessible names

title: Ensure color contrast compliance
description: Audit all text colors for WCAG AA contrast compliance (4.5:1 for normal text, 3:1 for large text). Fix any contrast issues, particularly in the slate/gray color palette.
rationale: Sufficient color contrast ensures text is readable for users with low vision or color blindness. The current slate color palette may have some borderline contrast ratios.
implementation_notes: Use browser dev tools or axe-core to audit contrast. Pay special attention to slate-400 and slate-500 text on dark backgrounds. May need to lighten some text colors. Consider adding a high-contrast mode toggle.
acceptance_criteria: All text meets 4.5:1 contrast ratio (or 3:1 for large text)
No contrast errors in axe-core audit

title: Comprehensive reduced motion support
description: Audit all animations and ensure they respect prefers-reduced-motion. Provide alternative static states or simplified animations for users who prefer reduced motion.
rationale: Animations can cause vestibular issues for some users. The flywheel already has reduced motion support, but other page animations may not.
implementation_notes: Use Framer Motion's useReducedMotion hook consistently. Replace complex animations with simple fades or no animation when reduced motion is preferred. Ensure Three.js scene also respects this preference.
acceptance_criteria: Site is fully usable with reduced motion
No vestibular-triggering animations when preference is set

title: Content & Features Enhancement
description: Add new content and features to increase engagement and utility, including populating the threads section with top tweets, adding search functionality, and improving project filtering.
rationale: The site has great infrastructure but some content gaps (empty threads section) and missing features that would improve user engagement and discoverability.
considerations: Search could be client-side for simplicity or use a service like Algolia for better results. Threads should showcase the most valuable/engaging content. Project filtering already exists but could be enhanced.

title: Populate threads section with top X posts
description: Add 6-9 of the highest-performing X posts to the threads array in content.ts, focusing on posts with high bookmark counts (indicating valuable content) and those that showcase the Flywheel ecosystem.
rationale: The threads section is currently empty, hiding a valuable content section. Jeffrey's X posts contain high-value insights about AI coding workflows that visitors would benefit from.
implementation_notes: Based on X analytics, prioritize: 1) Daily progress prompts post (812 bookmarks), 2) Flywheel stack post (531 bookmarks), 3) Unix tool philosophy post (113 bookmarks), 4) Intellectual humility post (153 bookmarks), 5) Coding agent update alias post (118 bookmarks), 6) Workflow demo post (104 bookmarks). Truncate long posts and add '...' with link to full thread.
acceptance_criteria: At least 6 high-quality posts added to threads array
Posts are properly truncated with links
Mix of workflow tips, philosophy, and Flywheel content

title: Implement site-wide search functionality
description: Add a search feature that allows users to search across projects, writing, and other content. Consider client-side search with Fuse.js or FlexSearch for simplicity.
rationale: Search is a standard feature users expect on content-rich sites. It helps users find specific projects, essays, or topics quickly.
implementation_notes: Options: 1) Client-side with Fuse.js (simple, no backend), 2) Pagefind (static site search, very fast), 3) Algolia (most powerful, requires account). Recommend starting with Pagefind or Fuse.js. Add search icon to header that opens modal/drawer.
acceptance_criteria: Can search projects by name, description, tags
Can search writing by title, content

title: Add project detail pages
description: Create individual pages for major projects (especially Flywheel tools) with more detailed information, screenshots, installation instructions, and links.
rationale: Currently all projects link directly to GitHub. Individual pages would improve SEO, provide more context, and keep users on-site longer.
implementation_notes: Create app/projects/[slug]/page.tsx with generateStaticParams. Extend Project type with optional longDescription, screenshots, installCommand fields. Start with Flywheel tools which are most important.
acceptance_criteria: At least Flywheel tools have detail pages
Links from project cards go to detail pages (with GitHub link on detail page)

title: Add newsletter signup
description: Add an optional newsletter signup form for users who want to be notified of new projects, essays, or updates. Use a simple service like Buttondown or ConvertKit.
rationale: Email remains the most reliable way to stay connected with an audience. A newsletter allows direct communication with interested users.
implementation_notes: Options: Buttondown (simple, developer-friendly), ConvertKit (more features), Substack (if also want to blog there). Add subtle signup form in footer or as a floating prompt after reading an essay. Respect user privacy, no dark patterns.
acceptance_criteria: No spam or dark pattern tactics

title: Enhance project filtering with tag-based search
description: Enhance the existing project filter to support filtering by tags in addition to kind. Allow users to click on tags to filter, and support combining multiple tag filters.
rationale: The current filter by kind (product, oss, research, flywheel) is useful but limited. Tag-based filtering would help users find projects by technology (Rust, Python, etc.) or domain.
implementation_notes: Extract unique tags from all projects. Add a tag filter section below the current filter bar. Use URL params to persist filter state. Support multiple tag selection (AND logic).

title: Developer Experience & Code Quality
description: Improve developer experience through better tooling, testing, and documentation. This supports long-term maintainability of the codebase.
rationale: As the site grows, maintaining code quality becomes more important. Good DX means faster iteration and fewer bugs.
considerations: Don't over-engineer. Focus on high-value improvements like error boundaries and basic tests rather than 100% coverage.

title: Add error boundaries to all major sections
description: Wrap all major page sections in error boundaries to prevent a single component error from crashing the entire page.
rationale: Currently only the Three.js scene has an error boundary. Other sections could crash the page if they encounter unexpected data or errors.
implementation_notes: Create reusable ErrorBoundary component (already exists). Wrap each SectionShell or major component in ErrorBoundary. Provide appropriate fallback UI for each section.
acceptance_criteria: All major sections wrapped in error boundaries
Errors in one section don't crash page
Fallback UI is appropriate for each section

title: Add basic component tests
description: Add basic tests for critical components using Vitest and React Testing Library. Focus on testing that components render without crashing and handle edge cases.
rationale: Basic tests catch regressions and document expected behavior. Start with critical components rather than trying to achieve high coverage.
implementation_notes: Set up Vitest with @testing-library/react. Write tests for: ProjectCard (handles missing fields), FlywheelVisualization (handles empty tools), content.ts exports. Don't test implementation details.

title: Add TypeScript strict mode improvements
description: Enable stricter TypeScript settings and fix any resulting type errors. Focus on strict null checks and noUncheckedIndexedAccess.
rationale: Stricter TypeScript settings catch more bugs at compile time and improve code quality.
implementation_notes: Incrementally enable strict options in tsconfig.json. Start with strictNullChecks if not already enabled. Consider noUncheckedIndexedAccess for array safety. Fix resulting errors rather than using type assertions.

title: Beads File Documentation
description: This beads file contains the comprehensive task breakdown for improving Jeffrey Emanuel's personal site. The improvements are organized into 5 epics: SEO & Metadata, Performance, Accessibility, Content & Features, and Developer Experience. Tasks within each epic are ordered by priority and have dependencies noted where relevant.
usage_notes: Use 'bv' (beads_viewer) to visualize dependencies and track progress. Start with high-priority tasks in each epic. Consider running SEO and Accessibility improvements in parallel as they have no dependencies on each other. Performance tasks should be done after initial content is in place.
